top_categories.workout_context: Garmin Gravel Worlds' Nebraska farmland, Rolling gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Garmin Gravel Worlds' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
65 miles on Nebraska rolling farmland gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Garmin Gravel Worlds' Nebraska rolling farmland gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
At Garmin Gravel Worlds, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on Nebraska rolling farmland gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Garmin Gravel Worlds. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Garmin Gravel Worlds, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Varied gradients on Nebraska rolling farmland gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Nebraska rolling farmland gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Base fitness for Garmin Gravel Worlds. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Garmin Gravel Worlds’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Garmin Gravel Worlds requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on nebraska rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: nebraska farmland, rolling gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Durability to prepare you for 65 miles of nebraska rolling farmland gravel in Lincoln, Nebraska.
